abstract: Last year AT&T warned smartphone customers with unlimited data plans that it may temporarily slow their Internet connection speeds if they were in the top 5 percent of heaviest data users. Only recently have some customers begun receiving notifications about their data connections being throttled, and AT&T says the policy isn't as bad as it seems.
lead_paragraph: Last year, AT&T warned smartphone customers with unlimited data plans that it may temporarily reduce their Internet connection speeds if they were in the "top 5 percent" of heaviest data users. Only recently have some customers begun receiving notifications about their data connections being slowed down, and AT&T claims that it isn't as bad as it seems.

headline.main: AT&T Says Throttling Policy Isn't as Bad as You Think
